intro: Navarretia nigelliformis, commonly known as the blackleaf navarretia, is a flowering plant native to California. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. It blooms in early spring and is known for its short-lived nature, completing its life cycle within a single growing season. Navarretia nigelliformis is also noted for its role in supporting local pollinators and its ecological importance in its native range.
